p: In addition to screening for crinivirus infection, a visual inspection of other known whitefly-transmitted viruses including torradoviruses, ipomoviruses, carlaviruses, and begomoviruses was carried out. Field observations showed that interveinal leaf chlorosis, chlorotic flecking, and leaf bronzing symptoms typically associated with crinivirus infection of tomatoes [ 10; 21] occurred more frequently amongst growers in South Africa [ 9] ( Fig 2).
